nodes.title: Prompt Loop 1
widgets_values: The scene explodes into action as a violent gust of wind nearly knocks the man over; he grabs his hat and stumbles forward while massive waves behind him crash explosively over the rocks, spraying water into the air.

nodes.title: Prompt Loop 2
widgets_values: Suddenly, a loud thunderclap startles the man; he flinches visibly and turns his head sharply to the left, his eyes widening in panic as he spots something terrifying off-screen.

nodes.title: Prompt Loop 3
widgets_values: Using all his strength, the man heaves the heavy door open; the wind instantly catches it and slams it against the inner wall, blowing his coat wildly as he rushes inside to escape the storm.

nodes.title: Prompt Loop 4
widgets_values: The man goes upstairs the spiral staircase while the camera follows him iin his haste.

nodes.title: Prompt Loop 5
widgets_values: He grabs the heavy iron lever and pulls it down with force. Immediately, the massive gears start to grind and turn, causing the giant lighthouse lens to rotate rapidly, casting spinning beams of light across the room.

nodes.title: Prompt Loop 6
widgets_values: The man frantically bangs his fists against the glass panes, shouting silently into the storm. Outside, the weather worsens significantly, with lightning strikes flashing rapidly and illuminating his desperate silhouette.

nodes.title: Prompt Loop 7
widgets_values: The man climbs over the safety railing of the lighthouse balcony. He teeters precariously on the edge for a split second, looking down at the churning water, before letting go and dropping out of the frame.

# WAN 2.2 Video Extender PRO - Workflow Guide

## üì¶ Recommended Model

(Feel free to try any other model, but VACE integration is required!)

**Download:** [WAN2.2-14B-Rapid-AllInOne](https://huggingface.co/Phr00t/WAN2.2-14B-Rapid-AllInOne)

Load the checkpoint and connect to the node.

## ‚öôÔ∏è Recommended Settings

- **Steps:** `4` (optimized for rapid generation)
- **Sampler:** `euler_a`
- **Scheduler:** `beta`
- **CFG:** `1.0` (default, adjust if needed)
- **Overlap Frames:** `16` (more overlap = better consistency)

## üé¨ Quick Start

1. **Input Options:**
   - Video: Extends existing video
   - Image: Creates video from static image
   - No input: Generates from scratch

2. **Extension Loops:**
   - Each loop generates `generate_frames` (default: 81 frames)
   - Use multiple loops for longer videos
   - Per-loop prompts & LoRAs supported

3. **Reference Image (Optional):**
   - Connect to maintain character consistency across loops
   - Works with VACE logic for better identity preservation

## üíæ Memory Optimization

This node uses **segment-based storage** to minimize VRAM/RAM usage:
- Only overlap frames kept in memory during generation
- Segments automatically saved to disk
- Final video assembled from all segments
- Aggressive cleanup between loops

**Memory footprint:** ~150-200MB during processing (vs 2GB+ without optimization)

## üîß Tips

- Start with 1-2 loops for testing
- Increase overlap for smoother transitions
- Use per-loop prompts for scene changes
- Reference image improves character consistency
- Check console output for detailed progress

## üìä Expected Performance

- **4 steps/frame** with euler_a/beta = ~1-2s per frame (GPU dependent)
- **81 frames** = ~5 seconds of video at 16fps
- **Multiple loops** = proportionally longer

---

**Node Version:** Memory Optimized with Disk-Based Segment Storage

nodes.title: GUIDE
widgets_values:
# WAN Video Extender - Settings Guide

## Main Settings

**steps**: 4 (higher = better quality, slower)

**cfg**: 1.0 (do not change for WAN)

**sampler_name**: euler

**scheduler**: simple

**num_frames**: 81 (frames per loop)

**overlap**: 12-16 (frames that blend between loops for smooth transitions)

**fps**: 16

**seed**: any number, use "fixed" for reproducible results

## Loop Settings (per loop)

**enable_endframe_X**: true = uses last frame from the next loop as input
- Loop 1: true (uses the first-frame-image from loop 2 as end frame)
- Loop 2+: true (uses frame from Loop 3 as last-frame)

**enable_prompt_X**: true = activates custom prompt for this loop

**prompt_loop_X**: what should happen in this loop (e.g. "camera pans left")

**lora_name_loop_X**: optional LoRA model for this loop

**lora_weight_loop_X**: 0.5-1.0 if using LoRA

## Reference Image

**enable_reference_image**: true = uses Global Reference Image for style/character consistency

## Workflow Logic

1. Loop 1 generates 81 frames from input video
2. Last frame of Loop 1 ‚Üí input for Loop 2
3. Loop 2 generates 81 frames
4. Overlap cuts last 12-16 frames and blends them smoothly
5. Repeat for all enabled loops
6. All loops are combined into one video

## Enable/Disable Loops

Right-click on "Loop X" ImageResize node:
- Mode ‚Üí Always = loop is used
- Mode ‚Üí Never = loop is skipped

Only enabled loops will be generated.
